President Bush refused to accept both times, keeping Donald Rumsfeld on at the Pentagon, where he turned into a lightning rod for criticism of the invasion and occupation of Iraq. In an exclusive interview with ABC's Diane Sawyer , Donald Rumsfeld also said the enhanced interrogation techniques he approved for use on the so-called "20th hijacker- including forced stress positions and removal of "comfort items"- produced invaluable intelligence." WINDSOR, ONTARIO- Chrysler is debating the future of its minivans even as it starts making the 2011 Dodge Grand Caravan and Chrysler Town and Country this week. We need to completely rethink the minivan, CEO Sergio Marchionne said Tuesday at the Canadian plant where Chrysler's minivans are made.
